message.content:
<<<api>>>: WebDriver.switchTo()
<<<code>>>: 
// After clicking the Facebook button
driver.findElement(By.className("facebookBtn")).click();

// Switch to the new window
for(String winHandle : driver.getWindowHandles()){
    driver.switchTo().window(winHandle);
}

// Now you can interact with the new window
driver.findElement(By.id("email")).sendKeys("selenium");
<<<explanation>>>: The problem is that when the Facebook login page opens in a new window, your WebDriver is still focused on the original window. You need to switch the WebDriver to the new window before you can interact with it. The switchTo().window() method allows you to do this. The getWindowHandles() method returns a set of window handles which can be used to iterate over all open windows of this WebDriver instance.
